member.name: T:GraphQL.ValueConverter
member.summary:
This class provides value conversions between objects of different types. Conversions are registered in a static thread safe dictionary and are used for all schemas in the application.
Each ScalarGraphType calls ConvertTo method to return correct value type from its ParseValue method. Also conversions may be useful in advanced GetArgument use cases when deserialization from the values dictionary to the complex input argument is required.

member.name: M:GraphQL.ValueConverter.#cctor
member.summary: Register built-in conversions. This list is expected to grow over time.

summary.para: Returns an object of the specified type and whose value is equivalent to the specified object.
Throws a if there is no conversion registered; conversion functions may throw other exceptions
Returns an object of the specified type and whose value is equivalent to the specified object.
Throws a if there is no conversion registered; conversion functions may throw other exceptions
If a conversion delegate was registered, converts an object to the specified type and returns true; returns false if no conversion delegate is registered.
Conversion delegates may throw exceptions if the conversion was unsuccessful

member.name: M:GraphQL.ValueConverter.Register(System.Type,System.Type,System.Func{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary:
Allows you to register your own conversion delegate from one type to another.
If the conversion from valueType to targetType is already registered, then it will be overwritten.
member.param: Type of original value.
Converted value type.
Conversion delegate; null for unregister already registered conversion.

member.summary:
Allows you to register your own conversion delegate from one type to another.

member.typeparam: Type of original value.
Converted value type.
member.param: Conversion delegate; null for unregister already registered conversion.

member.summary:
Allows you to register your own conversion delegate from dictionary to some complex object.
This method may be useful in advanced GetArgument use cases when deserialization from the values dictionary to the complex input argument is required.

member.typeparam: Converted value type.
member.param: Conversion delegate; null for unregister already registered conversion.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Execution.ExecutionHelper.CollectFields(GraphQL.Execution.ExecutionContext,GraphQL.Types.IGraphType,GraphQL.Language.AST.SelectionSet)
member.summary:
Before execution, the selection set is converted to a grouped field set by calling CollectFields(). Each entry in the grouped field set is a list of fields that share a response key (the alias if defined, otherwise the field name). This ensures all fields with the same response key included via referenced fragments are executed at the same time.
See http://spec.graphql.org/June2018/#sec-Field-Collection and http://spec.graphql.org/June2018/#CollectFields()

member.name: M:GraphQL.Execution.ExecutionHelper.ShouldIncludeNode(GraphQL.Execution.ExecutionContext,GraphQL.Language.AST.Directives)
member.summary:
Examines @skip and @include directives for a node and returns a value indicating if the node should be included or not.
Note: Neither @skip nor @include has precedence over the other. In the case that both the @skip and @include directives are provided on the same field or fragment, it must be queried only if the @skip condition is false and the @include condition is true. Stated conversely, the field or fragment must not be queried if either the @skip condition is true or the @include condition is false.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Execution.ExecutionHelper.DoesFragmentConditionMatch(GraphQL.Execution.ExecutionContext,System.String,GraphQL.Types.IGraphType)
member.summary:
This method calculates the criterion for matching fragment definition (spread or inline) to a given graph type. This criterion determines the need to fill the resulting selection set with fields from such a fragment.
See http://spec.graphql.org/June2018/#DoesFragmentTypeApply()

member.summary: Returns a list of subfields (child nodes) for a result node based on the selection set from the document.

member.name: T:GraphQL.IDocumentExecuter
member.summary:
Processes an entire GraphQL request, given an input GraphQL request string. This is intended to be called by user code to process a query.
Typical implementation starts metrics if enabled (see Metrics), relies on IDocumentBuilder to parse the query, IDocumentValidator to validate it, and IComplexityAnalyzer to validate the complexity constraints. Then it executes document listeners if attached, selects an execution strategy, and executes the query via IExecutionStrategy. Unhandled exceptions are handled as appropriate for the selected options.

The delegate is used to unify the different ways of specifying middleware. See additional methods in .
member.param: Middleware delegate.
member.returns: Reference to the same .

member.name: M:GraphQL.Instrumentation.IFieldMiddlewareBuilder.ApplyTo(GraphQL.Types.ISchema)
member.summary:
Applies all delegates specified by the method to the schema.
When applying to the schema, modifies the resolver of each field of each graph type adding required behavior. Therefore, as a rule, this method should be called only once during schema initialization. See .
member.param: The schema to which you want to apply middlewares.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the indicated type, populating it with the dictionary. Can use any constructor of the indicated type, provided that there are keys in the dictionary that correspond (case sensitive) to the names of the constructor parameters.
member.param: The source of values.
The type to create.

GraphType for matching dictionary keys with property names. GraphType contains information about this matching in Metadata property. In case of configuring field as Field(x => x.FName).Name("FirstName") source dictionary will have 'FirstName' key but its value should be set to 'FName' property of created object.

GraphType for matching dictionary keys with property names. GraphType contains information about this matching in Metadata property. In case of configuring field as Field(x => x.FName).Name("FirstName") source dictionary will have 'FirstName' key but its value should be set to 'FName' property of created object.
member.remarks: There is special handling for strings, IEnumerable<T>, Nullable<T>, and Enum.

summary.para: A field resolver returns an object for a given field within a graph.
The property defines the field resolver to be used for the field.

Typically an instance of FuncFieldResolver or AsyncFieldResolver is created when code needs to execute within the field resolver - typically by calling FieldBuilder.Resolve or FieldBuilder.ResolveAsync.
When mapping fields to source object properties via Field(x => x.Name), ExpressionFieldResolver is used.
When a field resolver is not defined, such as with Field("Name"), the static instance of is used.

member.summary: Returns an object or null for the specified field. If is a , then this task will be awaited to obtain the actual object.

summary.para: Attempts to return a value for a field from the graph's source object, matching the name of the field to a property or a method with the same name on the source object.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Resolvers.NameFieldResolver.CreateDelegate(System.Type,System.String)

summary.para: Dynamically creates the necessary delegate in runtime to get the property/method value of the specified type.

So resulting Func will be generated as {x => Convert(Convert(x, Person).Age, Object)}
1. First, the input parameter 'x' is converted from the object to a specific type.
2. The required property or method is extracted from casted value.
3. Then result is converted again to the object and returned from the method.

member.param: The type from which you want to get the value.
Property/method name.
member.returns: Compiled delegate to get the value.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Types.ISchema
member.summary:
The schema for the GraphQL request. Contains references to the 'query', 'mutation', and 'subscription' base graph types.
Also allows for adding custom directives, additional graph types, and custom value converters.
only requires the Query property to be set; although commonly the Mutation and/or Subscription properties are also set.

member.name: P:GraphQL.Types.ISchema.Initialized
member.summary: Returns true once the schema has been initialized.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.ISchema.Initialize
member.summary:
Initializes the schema. Called by before validating or executing the request.
Note that middleware cannot be applied once the schema has been initialized. See .
This method should be safe to be called from multiple threads simultaneously. However, field middleware must be applied in a thread-safe manner so that it is not applied to the schema multiple times.

member.summary:
Scalar types represent the leaves of the query - those fields that don't have any sub-fields.
More info about scalars.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.ScalarGraphType.Serialize(System.Object)
member.summary:
Result (output) coercion. It takes the result of a resolver and converts it into an appropriate value for the output result. In other words it transforms a scalar from its server-side representation to a representation suitable for the client.
Since GraphQL specifies no response format, Serialize is not responsible for preparing the scalar for transport to the client. It is only responsible for generating an object which can eventually be serialized by some transport-focused API.
member.param: Resolved value.
member.returns: The returned value of a the result coercion is part of the overall execution result. Normally this value is a primitive value like String or Integer to make it easy for the serialization layer. For complex types like a Date or Money Scalar this involves formatting the value. Returning null indicates a failed conversion.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.ScalarGraphType.ParseLiteral(GraphQL.Language.AST.IValue)
member.summary: Literal input coercion. It takes an abstract syntax tree (AST) element from a schema definition or query and converts it into an appropriate intenal value. In other words it transforms a scalar from its client-side representation as an argument to its server-side representation. Input coercion may not only return primitive values like String but rather complex ones when appropriate.
member.param: AST value node.
member.returns: Internal scalar representation. Returning null indicates a failed conversion.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.ScalarGraphType.ParseValue(System.Object)
member.summary:
Value input coercion. Argument values can not only provided via GraphQL syntax inside a query, but also via variable. It transforms a scalar from its client-side representation as a variable to its server-side representation.
Parsing for arguments and variables are handled separately because while arguments must always be expressed in GraphQL query syntax, variable format is transport-specific (usually JSON).
member.param: Runtime object from variables.
member.returns: Internal scalar representation. Returning null indicates a failed conversion.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.Schema.System#IServiceProvider#GetService(System.Type)
member.summary:
Gets the service object of the specified type. Schema itself acts as a service provider used to create objects, such as graph types, requested by the schema.
Note that most objects are created during schema initialization, which then have the same lifetime as the schema's lifetime.
Other types created by the service provider may include directive visitors, middlewares, validation rules, and name converters, among others.
Explicit implementation of the method makes this method less visible to the calling code, which reduces the likelihood of using it as so called ServiceLocator anti-pattern. However, in some advanced scenarios this may be necessary.
member.param: An object that specifies the type of service object to get.
member.returns: A service object of type or null if there is no service object of type serviceType.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.FragmentsOnCompositeTypes
member.summary:
Fragments on composite type:
Fragments use a type condition to determine if they apply, since fragments can only be spread into a composite type (object, interface, or union), the type condition must also be a composite type.

member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.summary:
Known argument names:

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.KnownDirectives
member.summary:
Known directives:

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.KnownDirectives.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.KnownFragmentNames
member.summary:
Known fragment names:

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.KnownFragmentNames.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.KnownTypeNames
member.summary:
Known type names:
A GraphQL document is only valid if referenced types (specifically variable definitions and fragment conditions) are defined by the type schema.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.KnownTypeNames.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.LoneAnonymousOperation
member.summary:
Lone anonymous operation:
A GraphQL document is only valid if when it contains an anonymous operation (the query short-hand) that it contains only that one operation definition.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.LoneAnonymousOperation.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoFragmentCycles
member.summary:
No fragment cycles:
A GraphQL document is only valid if it does not contain fragment cycles.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoFragmentCycles.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoUndefinedVariables
member.summary:
No undefined variables:
A GraphQL operation is only valid if all variables encountered, both directly and via fragment spreads, are defined by that operation.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoUndefinedVariables.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoUnusedFragments
member.summary:
No unused fragments:
A GraphQL document is only valid if all fragment definitions are spread within operations, or spread within other fragments spread within operations.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoUnusedFragments.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoUnusedVariables
member.summary:
No unused variables:
A GraphQL operation is only valid if all variables defined by that operation are used in that operation or a fragment transitively included by that operation.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoUnusedVariables.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.OverlappingFieldsCanBeMerged
member.summary:
Overlapping fields are mergable:
If multiple field selections with the same response names are encountered during execution, the field and arguments to execute and the resulting value should be unambiguous. Therefore any two field selections which might both be encountered for the same object are only valid if they are equivalent.
Due to the complexity of the implementation, this validation rule is not part of the default set of validation rules.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.PossibleFragmentSpreads
member.summary:
Possible fragment spread:
A fragment spread is only valid if the type condition could ever possibly be true: if there is a non-empty intersection of the possible parent types, and possible types which pass the type condition.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.PossibleFragmentSpreads.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.ProvidedNonNullArguments
member.summary:
Provided required arguments:
A field or directive is only valid if all required (non-null) field arguments have been provided.

member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.ScalarLeafs
member.summary:
Scalar leafs:
A GraphQL document is valid only if all leaf fields (fields without sub selections) are of scalar or enum types.
